website_summaries.verdict: This lightweight chainsaw is powerful enough for thick limbs or small trunks. The ability to go cordless sets it apart from other Worx models.
pros: This model includes the popular automatic tension and lubrication systems available on many Worx models
No need to stop work to tighten or oil the chain
The 20-volt battery lasts long enough to complete average-sized jobs
The battery power makes this unit portable, and the light weight makes it easy to carry and maneuver for almost any user
At just over 6 pounds, this is a light model compared to others
cons: This model is not designed for large jobs, and is not a good option for users who need to cut down or split large trees

customer_reviews.title: Another WORX homerun!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't write many reviews but this chainsaw blew me away. I have a WORX weed wacker and a WORX blower and I love the ease of operation for both-still, a chainsaw is a tall order. BUT, It exceeded my expectations on first use. Now, it's not for lumberjacks but I didn't need a monster saw anyways. It cut 4 inch limbs with ease and that's just what I needed. Oil and tension are automatic and no more dealing with the nightmare of a two stroke engine. CANT SAY ENOUGH GOOD ABOUT IT!!! I'm just mad I didn't buy it long ago. WAY TO GO WORX-you have never disappointed me.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and well balanced.
customer_reviews.text: It is light weight and well balanced. I have two gas powered chainsaws that work great but I need one for limb trimming and working on steep hill side. The Worx Chainsaw is the one. No pulling of a cord, no heavy and bulky saw, now I can work in better safer conditions. I don't use this saw for larger trees, just limbs and saplings.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Our New Xmas Chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: The PERFECT option for our annual Christmas Tree hunt! This little guy is amazing! So easy to set up, and use. The batteries seem to last a VERY long time and the best part, it’s the same battery I use in my WORX weed whacker. We always go out to the Christmas tree farm and cut down our trees. In the past we’ve always use the rental saws, which meant you were laying in the snow or the mud and trying to cut down a tree at an awkward angle. This guy is now our designated Christmas Chainsaw!
customer_reviews.author: delta_grimes

customer_reviews.title: Decent saw
customer_reviews.text: I just needed to cut a few branches less than 4 inches. Maybe 50. Tightening the chain is easy. But I forgot when I was cutting through 15 little branches at once and the chain slipped. But I was tired. And so was the saw. We took a break. I only had to use 2 hands on a higher limb. I like this light weight saw that tells me when to give up after 20 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis H.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and very quiet!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time today. Worked great! Quiet! Love it. We have a worx line trimmer with the same battery pack, so we can use it for quite a long time.
customer_reviews.author: ejs50

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my tools
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of equipment, is exactly what I expected. The battery last a good hour, and I liked the fact that there are no cords or gas to mix.
customer_reviews.author: gary e farnsworth

customer_reviews.title: Good saw but get extra battery
customer_reviews.text: I was really pleased with the saw itself. However, i was VERY dissapointed with battery life. I think it should come with a 40V battery personally. I mean you are chopping trees up, not cutting grass. I will be ordering another battery for backup. I would suggest you do the same if you order this one. And why not throw in a lil thing of oil? Make sure you buy some with this.
customer_reviews.author: BoatyMcBoatFace

customer_reviews.title: handy saw
customer_reviews.text: Seems very handy for branch clearing and trail opening. Only problem is manufacturer states to use a 5/32" file to sharpen chain. That is not the correct size file as the correct file is obviously smaller than that. I ordered that size before realizing they are telling everyone the wrong size. I have a 5/32" from my other saws and it DOES NOT fit the notch of the saw tooth. Beware of that and incorrect replacement chains listed on Amazon as many are .050 gauge and the chain is .043" not .050". Be careful and you might not waste time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: ANOTHER ASSEMBLY FIASCO BY WORX
customer_reviews.text: As with the WORX Hedge Trimmer I bought, this comes with extremely poor instructions for assembly. Only on this I gave up and will be returning it. Brief instructions say to install the chain and holder to the body in a place that's covered by the chain tension adjust assembly WITHOUT showing or telling how to remove the chain tension adjust assembly!!!! The assembly is a plastic housing installed on the saw with no visible way of removing it to install the chain. So, you risk breaking it or something else in trying to remove it. Putting mine back in the box and sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: jimbo57

customer_reviews.title: Fisher Price Made a Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Purchased both this chainsaw and a refurbished gas 20" Husqvarna on the same day to cut down a couple trees on my property. Tried out the Husqvarna first (great saw, FYI) ... then tried this little thing and immediately started laughing. This saw totally sounds and runs like a child's toy compared to the gas chainsaw, but *seriously* took down about 25-30 substantial branches on a dead 30 ft Ponderosa Pine with no problem. Swapped the battery and immediately de-branched a smaller, semi-live black locust with heavy wood. We were able to climb the tree, and (carefully) saw one-handed when needed ...which was useful. Overall worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SLE

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Chain ALWAYS comes off during use. Total waste of money. I finally threw this in my garbage can. The chain continued to come off during use. I read the directions several times and I watched a video on Youtube about this specific chainsaw and how to correctly work with the chain etc.
customer_reviews.author: TheGhostofBelleStarr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small jobs around the house
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight chainsaw, used it right away after it arrived on a 8" tree that had fallen over the driveway and it took care of that no problem. Not sure how long this thing would last on heavy duty tree clearing but for the occasional use its perfect. Easy to put together out of the box, very easy to run and use just make sure to fill the bar and chain oil up first before using it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Good little saw !
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Worx product. I have had gas powered chain saws before, but my first battery powered. I am very impressed with this tool. It's light weight and easy to handle. Chain tightened is easy to use and had no problem cutting 4" seasoned hardwood. The instructions tell you to lube the end of the chain bar before use. I found a spray can of Liquid Wrench white lithium grease at Harbor Frieght that does the trick. (The hole on the chain bar is very small) I am very happy with it for basic sawing of downed trees I have, branches, etc.
customer_reviews.author: ActionSpeaksLouder

customer_reviews.title: Buy a rapid charger
customer_reviews.text: With the 8hr. charger that comes with it, it's useless. With the rapid charger that costs $50.00 extra to buy it's great. Why don't they sell it with the rapid charger so you wouldn't have the useless slow charger to throw away? So they can make more money?
customer_reviews.author: Dave Truby

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous: Purchase at your own risk
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware: Once you turn it on, there's no turning it off. It just keeps going... and going... and going. You have to remove the battery to make it stop. That's not exactly a safe thing to do while a chainsaw is going. I received this 34 days ago, so of course it's no longer covered under the return policy, but I'll be pursuing other methods of reimbursement plus checking to see if a safety organization can make the company create a safe item or get this one taken off of the market until the company fixes it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: wife stole it from me
customer_reviews.text: wife likes it so I'll let her review it ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The Worx Chainsaw (WG322) is a great product! Its light weight and the battery is also light weight - compared to our other chainsaw. I love that its self-oiling. Not having to hit an oil button saves me a lot of time. I'm 5'4", 100 lbs and my husband is disabled with very limited use of his arms. And neither of us had absolutely any problems operating it. I was outside for 2 hrs using it on limbs and large branches (up to 4 inches round) and I could have kept going. It doesn't wear out my arms. The battery still had a lot of life in it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: great for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: I have a regular gas chainsaw for big jobs, and I use this for smaller jobs. It's nice not having to mix gas and oil just to cut down a small tree. I let friends and family borrow it (so I can keep my gas chainsaw $$ at home).
customer_reviews.author: gulf_racer

customer_reviews.title: Runs great on batt power..
customer_reviews.text: I have always wondered how these battery chainsaws would hold up to cutting wood. To say I was pleasantly surprised would be an understatement. Put this baby together, filled up chain oil and went to the trees. Filled up the very back of my truck, side to side and to top of closed tailgate on original battery and part of extra battery I bought and filled up with oil 1 time. Cutting wood up to 5 inches and up to 16 inches long for a small firepit I have. Only used one time so can't talk of durability yet. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you recognize what this is for, it is a steal!!!
customer_reviews.text: anyone that buys a 10 inch chain saw, and then expects it to cut down big thick trees, or hold up to continual commercial use, deserves exactly what they will get if it fails in that objective. BUT: for those who just want a very light weight, efficient, easy to use , consumer level tool that will handle small jobs with consummate ease, then , this is the power tool for you. Very easy to install the blade and the tightening system is just fine, and equally easy....again, recognize what it is, use it accordingly, and it will be a God-send for many of the typical things that average people would need it for.
customer_reviews.author: John Gargani

customer_reviews.title: This saw has a surprising amount of cutting power for a battery powered saw that's so small.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for garden work. It is small and lightweight, which makes it easy to maneuver for a small person. I have used it to saw through limbs as thick as 5" (but at that diameter, you need to work at it a bit). Downside: (1) When saw not in use, the chain oil leaks out all over the place until the oil receptacle is empty (should be a way to close it off); (2) the chain is a little loose in hot weather even when adjusted to maximum tightness and came off once while I was sawing. The good new is that the saw stopped immediately and no damage done to it or me.
customer_reviews.author: KKCB

customer_reviews.title: Baby brute👍
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying a baby 10" battery saw but was pleasantly surprised. Chain came off a few times before I figured out proper tensioning. Plenty of power and battery life to make short order of a troublesome crepe myrtle
customer_reviews.author: JLT

customer_reviews.title: Small electric saw but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This saw may be small, but it does the job. It may be battery powered, but being 20V for battery power, the charge lasts a good long time. I like the automatic oil feed so I don't have to worry about keeping the blades lubricated. More maneuverable then an electric saw and don't have to worry about cords getting in the way. I like it being battery powered because I hate mixing oil and gas and keeping track of stuff like that. If it runs out of power, I just put in a different battery and go back to taking out branches. Easy to maintain and light weight. Worx, works wonderfully!!
customer_reviews.author: t winters

customer_reviews.title: LIGHT AND EASY FOR THIS 5’ LADY TO USE!
customer_reviews.text: I’m nervous around regular chain saws but wanted something small and easy for me to handle for little jobs around the yard and while camping. This is perfect! It’s not as loud as a regular chain saw so not as disruptive to other campers. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Christianson

customer_reviews.title: Received a returned product, not nice
customer_reviews.text: The saw is a first class product. The price is fair. Five stars for that. The saw was a returned product. The person who returned the saw drained the oil and put it in a Kohl's plastic bag with oil all over the package. The reason it was returned, I assume, was because the blade was installed backward and didn't cut. After cleaning off the oil, installing new chain oil, reinstalling the chain correctly and charging the battery I tested it on backyard trees. Cut 3 to 4 inch tree branches and was satisfied. Obviously no one checked the returned produce.
customer_reviews.author: Starlight

customer_reviews.title: Great little Chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Lasica high-capacity 5000mAhr battery to use with this saw and am very happy with the performance. Had to cut up an 18" windfall oak tree in my yard, and the battery almost lasted for the whole job with a huge pile of 15" firewood at the end. The saw is light but powerful once you learn how to keep the chain in contact with the wood. The easy start/stop makes it much safer than my Stihl gas model because I can put it down after each cut if necessary. Run the saw only for the exact time you are cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving purchase
customer_reviews.text: I just began using this lightweight chainsaw. Came to find out that the battery is for very short use. something might be wrong with it. However my window for return is closed and Amazon is not taking phone calls. As I began to research Amazon for additional batteries and chargers I found out through a customer service representative that they don't carry the items . He referred me to Worx. Worx in turn does not have any of these two items even in their website. Very frustrating .
customer_reviews.author: M C

customer_reviews.title: Performance
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for an light duty electric chain saw, keep looking. I have many Works tools and this one is the first I am disappointed in. I can not recommend purchasing this chainsaw. The chain tensioner does not work well and when cutting with the unit the chain kept coming off and I had to place it back in position way to many times. You could very easily get hurt using this chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Przewoznik

customer_reviews.title: The chain keeps coming off the blade every 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I did not want the chain to be too tight so I followed the instruction manual. The chain kept getting thrown off and just a few cuts. I keep tighting the chain but it doesn't seem to help much. Also, battery power seems somewhat inadequate even though I recharge the battery each time I use it. Did not have these problems with the jig saw. It worked quite well. Haven't decided if I want to keep the chain saw or not. Will try it a few more days anyway. Shipping was fast.
customer_reviews.author: Rperry38

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it out to do branch trimming. After 2 trims the chain kept coming off. This could really hurt someone. Very dissatisfied. Wish I used it when I got it so it could b returned.
customer_reviews.author: Terri manchestwr

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: I have used this here in Florida to cut pepper trees, etc. I have used it in swampy conditions and have cut dozens of trees with the first chain (I did buy a cheap file to semi-sharpen the teeth occasionally). I've also cut three medium sized pine trees. Overall a lot of work from this little saw. I feel safe with it since it doesn't have the ability to overpower me. Chainsawing is still a very physical activity but you can get it done with this. I've been clearing some land behind my house.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Love love love it! We have a gas and electric chainsaw both I hate. Too big and heavy. Got this one because I want help with firewood. I have their edger/weed whacker and already loved that. This works great for me. Lightweight, easy to handle and cuts like butter. Got two barrels full on one battery charge. I wanted to keep going so I'm going to buy an extra battery. Batteries are not interchangeable. Weed whacker 32 volts the saw is 20 volts. I would recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Harrison

customer_reviews.title: very good for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I'm not trying to bring down a forest, but this smaller chainsaw works well for the trimming and pruning of the branches of my trees and bushes. No need to maintain a gasoline engine. But quite powerful. Easily cut through branches that were 2-3 inches thick, and I'm sure it will work for larger branches. Seems very solid and powerful! (Note: you need to buy some chain oil at Lowes or Home Depot before using it the first time.)
customer_reviews.author: Dr. W.

customer_reviews.title: Chainsaw not strong to hold battery life
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chainsaw for my husband and he began using it recently. He is unable to finish the job as quick as He promised to a customer due to the battery life. The batteries died quickly, and take forever to recharge. I am completely disappointed in this product. Would like a refund and return it.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: No Problems So Far
customer_reviews.text: I have other Worx products and really havent been disappointed in any. Got this and have done one job w/ it so far so I really havent been able to test out battery life as it lasted thru the job I did. It cut thru some decently thick branches off a tree. Prob 6-9in in diameter. I wouldnt take a whole tree down w/ it but for jobs you would do w/ a saw trimming off larger branches this would work fine. That one job alone was worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie D

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, and easy to manage
customer_reviews.text: I am 44, 5'2", and 140 pounds. This thing was so easy to use. I've cleaned up my whole yard which had trees with 6 inch diameter trunks. Be careful not to chop off your toes because it really feels light and free. I used my sunglasses, but you should buy protective eyewear because of the flying chips. You also need chainsaw oil (I used vegetable oil at first which works too).
customer_reviews.author: SKMG

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: This saw will cut a pine tree up to 6'" in diameter. The battery has lasted as long as I have used it in one day which is 1-2 hours so I don't know how long it would go. The battery is interchangeable with one I have for a Black and Decker trimmer so I have a replacement if needed. The chain is easy to replace if it comes off track. I can do it standing up in the field. Perfect light weight saw for my firewising in the Arizona Ponderosa/Pinon/Juniper forest.
customer_reviews.author: Kent and Jolene

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Returning this product at vendor's request. After charging the battery and adding oil I was able to cut down one smal tree and a few other small cuts and then the saw stopped working. It would just spin the chain a few times and then stop. I left it alone for 30 minutes in case it was overheated but had the same issue - even the next day. The saw simply wont work any longer. Even tried re-seating the bar and chain but nothing worked. I should've bought a gas chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I OWN 5 OTHER CHAINSAWS. THIS THING IS INADEQUATE ON IT'S BEST DAY. CHAIN JUMPS OFF, LEAKS OIL AND BATTERY IS WOEFULLY SHORT-LIVED--
customer_reviews.author: BAD2THB1

customer_reviews.title: Great product for my wife
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted this for Valintines Day, so I reluctantly got it. I was actually pretty impressed. it works better than I expected. As far as the complaints about leaking bar oil...It is a gravity flow system, what do you expect. I have two suggestions; first - only fill with enough oil for the job at hand; second- when not in use, [;ace it in a 7 gallon bucket with the bar up (it will not leak a drop this way). Good luck
customer_reviews.author: billb

customer_reviews.title: Mine was a dud. Could reach no one for return.
customer_reviews.text: I tried so hard to return this when I first used it. I could reach no one! It jumps when trying to use. It is not safe. I think mine may have been defective. I am stuck with an item that I paid for and cannot safely use.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Houseman

customer_reviews.title: A step forward but lacking for any real repetitive work
customer_reviews.text: I’m need of an update. Lightweight and easy to manage which are both a plus. However, it’s lacking in power significantly. I would recommend using a power chord/plug in type of chain saw if your wanted to stay electric, and also if your wanting to cut through branches/wood thicker than 2 inches. Especially repetitively throughout the day. You will save lot of time and energy to that way. Great idea, just needs to be updated with more power. Wish I could return mine but I didn’t use it til it was past the return date sadly :(.
customer_reviews.author: sterling pierce taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller jobs
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a heavy duty chainsaw, so as long as you’re looking for something smaller and lightweight it’s perfect. We’ve used it to cut down several small fruit trees (about 4 inches in diameter) and it did well. It’s much quieter than a gas chainsaw. Sometimes the chain gets gunked-up or loose, but it’s easy to fix. I would recommend having several Worx batteries you can switch out. They probably last about an hour at a time depending on how much you’re doing.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Extension Pole not Available
customer_reviews.text: I cannot, apparently, get the extension pole for this product because the company has discontinued it. It does not come with any bar and chain lube, it advises you to fill the compartment with lube before using. I have used it to cut 4 in diameter trunks of both living and dead trees. It works well. Hopefully they will release the extension pole in the future.
customer_reviews.author: J. White

customer_reviews.title: Worx tools do the job!
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw has met all our requirements. We're clearing 40 years of English Ivy from a 7 foot, wooden fence, that has a heavily developed branching structure, and this Worx chain saw allows us completely and with delicate control, clear the ivy, and without damaging the support structure, has great battery life, and meets all our demands.
customer_reviews.author: C. Doughty

customer_reviews.title: OK for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: As you'd expect this saw is good for limbs around 4" or smaller, but no up to heavier jobs. The battery life is decent to get a small job done but don't expect to be out all day. The major issue I've had is that it bucks like crazy. Maybe that's due to the light weight or slower chain speed. In any case of you're careful it's not a big deal. Just something to watch out for.
customer_reviews.author: CNorris

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Great for small jobs. I've used it a couple of times and it's quick and convenient. Of course I wouldn't expect it to compete with a gas powered saw but it works well for cutting limbs off trees and could probably cut a ten or twelve inch diameter tree if you're patient. Probably need to recharge the battery often for a big job though. Bob R
customer_reviews.author: Robert Reedy

customer_reviews.title: Wrong book.
customer_reviews.text: We were sent the wrong book with this and we can't get the chain to tighten. The oil just pours down the saw doesn't go on the chain and bar. We have had chainsaws of all kinds so we know how they work. We have just got to the point in our lives we wanted something lightweight and easy. So could we get the right book and some help or do I just send it back?
customer_reviews.author: Connas

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Who would have thought a small battery powered chain saw could actually work? It's good for many small jobs and simple easy to to use. Pros: No gas mix, No yanking on the start rope, Quiet, Lightweight, Cons; Will cut only 6-8 Inch Dia. One battery lasted over 1/2 hour. I don't last much longer than that. 2 Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: A great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Found this refurbished and was a little wary. Unit was packed fine with all the parts and instructions. Used after past few storms. Easy to use and Battery seems to have good run time. Perhaps this weekend will put to test and run till battery needs recharge. Thank you Amazon for great product at value price.
customer_reviews.author: MIkeZ

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship
customer_reviews.text: Received package without any oil in the reservoir because it leaked all over the machine and inside the box. Other tools that we purchased from the same company came with the oil in a separate container. Chain was installed backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Cordless
customer_reviews.text: Since we have a acre it is easier to use the cordless chainsaw. Have used the corded chainsaw but have to take cords and a generator to do the job. I do find that if I apply to much pressure the chain will jump off. But, overall I really like the cordless chainsaw
customer_reviews.author: Verna Prell

customer_reviews.title: Good for You Unless You’re a Lumberjack
customer_reviews.text: Very good little chainsaw. It’s lighter in weight than an electric chainsaw. I’m a woman and I’m not young or in shape. I was able to cut through one foot wooden columns - it took awhile. You just have to be patient. The only downside is the battery life which isn’t spectacular. It doesn’t last long and recharge is longer than expected. An extra battery is about $50. Still, it should meet the needs of the average homeowner. It’s not for a lumberjack or farmer ... you probably already figured that out.
customer_reviews.author: Amateur

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it was made for.
customer_reviews.text: Let's be honest. This was not designed to cut down trees. But it was made to be a solution for the typical home owner to trim trees and bushes around the yard and use the same 20-V batteries you have for other things. For that purpose, it is great. I am very happy with it. First project: trim up an Orange tree branch I needed to remove and put it in the green waste -- done. Second Project: go remove the palm tree off-shoots that were popping up around the palm tree and put them in the green waste -- done. Used 1/4 of the battery charge. This works great for me!
customer_reviews.author: Horace K Burgon

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do some light trimming of thicker hedges and limbs around the house. It works incredibly well, it's the perfect size for light work. It's very well made, easy to use and light. Don't forget to buy bar oil with it unless you have some on hand. This is the second product I've purchased from Workx and I'm incredibly impressed.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has a Bartlett pear tree that was way over grown. I volunteered to top it. Used this worx 20 volt chainsaw. It was amazing. Here I am climbing in this tree...cutting branches that are up to 20 feet long...no way I could have done this with a gas saw...which would of been too heavy. You will love this saw...long battery life as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jim & Diane pulley

customer_reviews.title: A nice old lady chainsaw😁
customer_reviews.text: First time using a chainsaw. I am terrified of them. I am really happy with this one. It is lightweight and not too noisy. I did the barrow full of logs in no time. Still had power. The assembly directions weren't great, but it was relatively easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: maggie

customer_reviews.title: This thing exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little chain saw! I went around my yard trimming trees that had branches that were too low to the ground. Sliced right through them like butter! It is quiet but powerful. I never ran out of battery after I was done and I probably could have gone around again. Great tool, great design, and I am a WORX convert. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: C.Dobis

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Oil Bad
customer_reviews.text: Leaks Oil bad. Used once then stored away (approx, 5 months) and oil was all over ...what a mess!! Very disappointed in the product. I never intended to use it daily. Would not recommend and would return but very much past my return date.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. G.

customer_reviews.title: Product works well one-handed use is a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Project is good Cuts great but I don't like how much oil it likes to spew as well as leak when not in use as well as the auto tensioner is not hot though it is manual once I figured that out things went really well as with most of my work I have never had any issues I do recommend but you may not want to fill the chamber full of oil
customer_reviews.author: Bladethebold

customer_reviews.title: Worx collection great addition
customer_reviews.text: Works well for description. Needs a clearer description for oil needed for chain if used often. Also not your fault but description on assembly for chain not the greatest. If you have Worx system then add this to collection.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri L. Keating

customer_reviews.title: Chain comes off too easily
customer_reviews.text: Had to return due to chain falling off too easily and frequently. Tried a Ryobi and much happier with it. Of course the chain has to be tightened/comes off sometimes, as will happen with all chain saws, but not with the frequency I was having with the WORX model. When the chain wasn't falling off it did cut well, is lightweight and easy to use generally.
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: Love my Worx saw
customer_reviews.text: When I first used the saw, I kept having trouble keeping the chain on and putting it back on was a pain in the butt. But, I started cleaning the vines and briars away before I can a limb, the chains comes off very little. I also figured out a better way of putting the chain back on. No gas, no trying to get it to crank. Just slap a battery on it and go to work. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool.
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure if this little chain saw would work, but it was quite a shock when I started cutting and it did not quit. The battery just kept going, cutting limbs up to 8" thick and after a few hours it never stopped. My only problem with the machine was it would throw the chain once in a while, but that is easily remedied. Great job!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Hermann

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: This is just perfect for all that trimming in the yard!! Easy to handle, simple to assemble, and gets the job done. I suggest having an extra battery, we have the weed trimmer also, so have 2 batteries. We got 40-60 minutes out of the battery. Not for big stuff, but great for small to medium.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy W

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t personally used it yet; but, my son came over and did a lot of trimming for me and he kept saying how great it was! I have many WORX products and always brag on the ease of use & how well they perform. He said several times how impressed & surprised he was with it. The battery lasted through LOTS of cutting and had restored full charge in a couple of hours. We liked it so much I ordered the 20v power share pole saw! because it wasn’t much more than buying just the pole and now on the next trimming day I can handle the lower limbs and he can take the higher ones!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Not Big Enough . . .
customer_reviews.text: This was no powerful than a pruning saw . . . I needed a lot more oomph!
customer_reviews.author: Klaus Seaquist

customer_reviews.title: Bugs galore in this unit
customer_reviews.text: After using it for light cutting, the chain would repeatedly fall off. I had to clean the unit often, but it didn't do any good. Also, the chain oil leaks all over the place. This is the only Worx product I've purchased that I truly regret making...
customer_reviews.author: James Southard

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Did not have high expectations for either battery life or how robust it might be. Bought it for a young man who was dying to run my gas powered Stihl and have been very impressed! He gets done quite a bit with it and I have determined it is a legitimate Chainsaw! Have experienced the chain falling off. It definitely needs to be torqued, once you feel you have over-tightend it we have not had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Hefferon

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing lightweight but strong only thing is battery life doesn’t last as long. Just buy another battery and have one charging while using one if you are doing a lot of cutting
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: This is not a toy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a 16" corded Remington chain saw. Boy did this little baby show that one up. In fairness, it did last and never broke down and it was an older model, but for the price, this is one heck of a buy. Automatic oiler and self adjusting chain, you can't go wrong. Good warranty too.
customer_reviews.author: RobFromCT

customer_reviews.title: light weight cordless chain saw
customer_reviews.text: A great little saw for quick trimming/limbing. Not for regular heavy duty chainsaw work. For what its intended for it works very well. Oiler leaks a bit, but they all do.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Rawlins

customer_reviews.title: Great cutting, easy handling
customer_reviews.text: Easy to handle, cuts well. Have used for yard trimming of plant trunks, stumps, and branches from <1/2" up to 6"-8" diameter. This saw out-performed my neighbor's corded saw in quickly finishing off his straining attempt to cut through the 6"-8" trunk of an over large shrub in his yard. He was impressed that this battery powered. One drawback: the oil reservoir leaks oil onto workbench top and also onto clothing if not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Oldster

customer_reviews.title: easy operation light handling.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box use was too easy. Saw did the same job as my gas saw but less expensive and can store it without the worry of gas locking up the carb during long storage. Just plug the battery in and go to work. Sold my gas saw for more than the purchase price of the new Worx WG 322.
customer_reviews.author: jim of Florida

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and super quiet. I love everything this company makes. No little detail goes unnoticed... example saw blade storage cover. However, If you leave oil in the saw when done the oiler continues to old the chain no matter what causing oil to leak everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Choochoo

customer_reviews.title: saw
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for our daughter and she loves it. Lightweight and easy to handle. Just right for a small woman
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: What a good investment for small to medium work around the house! I would recommend though to have two batteries in standby for more that 30 minutes of operation
customer_reviews.author: MPB

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big chain saw guy. I've gotten old, and there are a lot of things I just can't do now. This little saw looked like a toy to me, but it works. It could use a bucking tooth or claw, but it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Heard

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: If you don't know how to adjust your chains and don't want to worry about oiling anything, this is perfect! It does great for small gardening jobs with minimal fuss and maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: lil789

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Machine
customer_reviews.text: Uses the same battery as my Worx weed trimmer. I haven't gotten around to putting it together so I can use it yet but being a Worx product, I'm sure it'll be grand.
customer_reviews.author: Teamjj

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a real little dynamo. I've taken down trees and stumps a little over 6 inches in diameter with this, which is really surprising the shorter blade. And it has plenty of power even though it's battery powered (as others have said, it gives you 20-25 minutes per charge). I have a second battery that I got with the worx weed whacker and it's handy having two on hand. I'd say it's sweet spot are those thicker branches that other tools often struggle with.
customer_reviews.author: JDL

customer_reviews.title: Does what is expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep in vehicle. Easy to use but don't expect the chips to fly like crazy. Good for small limbs. Get a real saw for anything bigger than your wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle chain saw
customer_reviews.text: This does the job I thought it would. I can cut dead limbs off of trees with little effort. The chain went on easily and assembly was easy. I almost like seeing dead limbs in my yard now, so I can saw them in pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will love it
customer_reviews.text: This was is fantastic. I've used loud chainsaws for years. Had ear protection, but it was still noisey. This is quiet easy to use a real sensible way to get the work done. Wish it had 2 or 3 batteries, but hey you going to need them anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good price and great performance!
customer_reviews.text: It only has a 10 inch bar, so it's best for shrubs and small tree limbs. The battery does a good job of lastong 45 mins. I was able to cut up a large 30 plus foot tree about 20 inches diameter.
customer_reviews.author: SJW

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Was a little reluctant to purchase this item since I bought the Jaws version of this battery powered saw and was not satisfied with performance and chain jumped of the guide bar very often during use. Can't believe I went with out this saw for so long. So far no problems and the chain stays on the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Popeye

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Works ok ,don't expect too much and you'll be satisfied . I use it for cutting underbrush ,small limbs ,etc . Battery life is reasonable as far as I can tell ,lasts long enough to get the job done . Easily handled ,lightweight .
customer_reviews.author: bruce

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Changing out all yard tools to Worx as others quit working. This is easy to use and has a lot of power and love how the batteries in all of the yard tools I have use the same batteries! I had so many chargers before and now I have one!
customer_reviews.author: Judy H.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little tool. The adjustment and maintenance is so easy, it only takes seconds to change the chain. I don't handle big trees but up to six inches in diameter is easy. It is a lot quieter than a gas engine. A battery last about 20 to 30 minutes. A couple of 20v batteries will get you through half a cord. A full oil tank will last about 2 batteries life. But it is perfect and light enough to take anytime, anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: April Russ

customer_reviews.title: Tough little saw!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband & I both love this saw. I'm a little woman so for me to be able to saw a tree down is a real ego boost. This little saw is tough & really stands up to the job.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES D.

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: Im in my 60s and just dont have the same strength i use to but still have the work to do. This little saw makes chores doable.
customer_reviews.author: Tuskie

customer_reviews.title: Let it work at its own pace
customer_reviews.text: Have not used yet but I'm sure it is as good as the jawsaw I have. It will be perfect for my needs. No gas or electrical chords mnn
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: We are impressed at how well this this works...lightweight easy to handle and lots of time on one charge of battery. Was used to cut brush of various sizes...no problem
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy as a pocket on your shirt!
customer_reviews.text: We live on 40 acres of mixed meadow and forest in a wildfire prone area. This saw is perfect for climbing up trees where the pruning saw is a bit overkill. And not having to pull start is a big plus. The battery life could be a bit better but, with an extra always on the charger, it's definitely not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: D. J.

customer_reviews.title: Works Products are the Best!
customer_reviews.text: The battery powered chainsaw is the handiest tool for those pesky tree limbs. Anyone who mows there lawn with a riding mower having to dodge low hanging tre limbs needs this product. The battery lasted much longer than expected. Very happy with my purchase. Shipping came as promised!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte M Ricks

customer_reviews.title: The battery in this Worx does not work with any of my other WORX tool.
customer_reviews.text: The battery that came with this will not work in any of our other Worx tools that we already have, and vice versa the batteries we already have will not work with this one. I fill this is a knock off, and not the real Worx!!!
customer_reviews.author: victor russell

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasted over an hour of almost continual limbing-up of trees. Easily cut limbs up to 4" diameter. Only negative I have found is the speed of the chain is a little slow, and doesn't cut as smoothly as a gas powered one would.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Boroughs

customer_reviews.title: weight
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed by the power it had. For a little chain saw, this one is GREAT. I've used an 8' McCallan, 2 man saw and this little guy cuts as well it.
customer_reviews.author: norwegiankid

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have the Jaw Saw but sometimes I need something larger, I have always been intimidated by chain saws they can be dangerous. This item is easy to use and light weight no pulling a cord to get it going I have cut some decent size trees up with it. The battery does not last as long in this as the jaw saw my guess is because it is more powerful. I would definitely recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila pashley

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw!
customer_reviews.text: Great for small jobs around the home, best to have a second battery ready to go. One really is NOT enough!
customer_reviews.author: Bongo

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I use it all the time if husband doesn't get it from me. We tell everyone, its the best chainsaw we ever had. Great for small women. Very light and extremely simple to put chain back on if it comes off (Which is not often).
customer_reviews.author: delightark

product_meta.title: Worx WG322 20V Power Share Cordless 10-inch Chainsaw with Auto-Tension
product_meta.description: Style:Battery + Charger IncludedWORX 10 Inches cordless chain saw boosts the 20V Power share platform with innovative technology. The patented tool-free auto chain tension system prevents over tightening & keeps optimal chain tension while cutting. Combined with an automatic oiling system with indicator & a compact design allows this saw to be practical in any quick clean up or pruning task.
feature_bullets: [FAST, CLEAN CUTS] This cordless 20V PowerShare chain saw is as fast and powerful as anything in its class. And with no gas and no cord, there’s much less muss and fuss
[AUTO-CHAIN TENSION] The automatic, tool-free chain tension system ensures you’ll always have the correct tension for the job at hand

[AUTO-CHAIN LUBRICATION] The automatic chain lubrication system not only makes for smoother, more efficient cuts, it extends the life of the tool. And the oil level indicator lets you know exactly where you stand
[COMPACT, LIGHTWEIGHT] It weighs 6.2 lbs., about as much as a 2-Liter bottle of soda. You’ll work longer, with less strain
[DO IT ALL WITH THE SAME BATTERY] Do it all with WORX PowerShare, the only cordless tool platform that uses the same battery to power 20V and 40V tools

[A FAST CHAIN SPEED] 12.5 ft/s. will tear through any reasonably sized log or branch. That speed, combined with our auto-tension and auto-oil systems, and the overall lightweight design, makes for one smooth saw experience
[PLENTY OF JUICE] These are the same batteries we use on our Jawsaw and in our lawnmowers. They’re powerful enough for those, and powerful enough for a chainsaw

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars831 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
